messages.page_content:
- Topic: Roll Call
- Summary: The roll call showed seven members present, constituting a quorum. No members were absent.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Pledge of Allegiance and National Anthem

- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: N/A
- Tags/Keywords: Pledge of Allegiance, National Anthem

- Topic: Approval of the Minutes
- Summary: The minutes from the February 3, 2022, and February 17, 2022, meetings were approved.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Approval of the meeting minutes
- Tags/Keywords: Meeting minutes, Approval

- Topic: Recognition of Percy Pugh
- Summary: A presentation was made to recognize Percy Pugh, a notable welterweight boxer known as "The Black Cobra," who passed away at the age of 81.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Recognition of Percy Pugh's contributions
- Tags/Keywords: Percy Pugh, Boxer, Recognition

- Topic: Recognition of "The Magic Jones"
- Summary: A presentation was made to recognize "The Magic Jones" for their Grammy-nominated album "All 1 Tribe" and their contributions to the entertainment industry.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Recognition of "The Magic Jones"
- Tags/Keywords: The Magic Jones, Grammy nomination, Entertainment industry
- UID: 2e1dd352-0356-4cb6-8ab2-660676177e8a

- Topic: Street Name Change for Louisa Street
- Summary: The ordinance proposed changing the name of the portion of Louisa Street running from Almonaster Avenue to Florida Avenue to Johnny Jackson Jr. Avenue. The City Planning Commission recommended a modified approval to rename Louisa Street between Florida Avenue and Chef Menteur Highway as Johnny Jackson Jr. Boulevard.
- Ordinance Number: 33555
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with amendments to rename the specified portion of Louisa Street.
- Tags/Keywords: Street Name Change, Louisa Street, Johnny Jackson Jr. Avenue, City Planning Commission
- UID: 20b65bb8-6eb0-49ed-91f6-5199ec941730

- Topic: Providing regulations for a DBE classification for formerly incarcerated
- Summary: The ordinance provided regulations for a Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (DBE) classification for formerly incarcerated individuals.
- Ordinance Number: SNC001-22
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: DBE, formerly incarcerated, regulations, amendment
- UID: 7e3cef1c-f850-4978-af09-ca6eb9dd7b37

- Topic: Directing the Chief Administrative Office to develop regulations required by Section 70-465
- Summary: The ordinance directed the Chief Administrative Office to develop regulations required by Section 70-465.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-95
- Votes Summary: This ordinance did not have a specific vote outcome mentioned in the provided text.
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Criminal Justice Committee, no specific vote outcome mentioned.
- Tags/Keywords: Chief Administrative Office, regulations, Section 70-465
- UID: 7e3cef1c-f850-4978-af09-ca6eb9dd7b37

- Topic: Amendment to Motion M-22-95
- Summary: The amendment proposed by Councilmember Moreno aimed to direct the Chief Administrative Office to develop regulations required by Section 70-465 of the Code of the City of New Orleans within 90 days, with additional recommendations to expand and improve the City's existing Equitable Business Opportunities Program.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-95 - Amendment
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment passed, directing the Chief Administrative Office to develop the required regulations and additional recommendations within the specified timeline.
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, Equitable Business Opportunities Program, Chief Administrative Office, Regulations
- UID: 4231cbf3-9943-4783-a909-9038acf5d4f6

- Topic: Motion (Lying Over) - M-22-95
- Summary: The motion aimed to direct the Chief Administrative Office to develop regulations required by Section 70-465 of the Code of the City of New Orleans within 90 days.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-95
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed, directing the Chief Administrative Office to develop the required regulations within the specified timeline.
- Tags/Keywords: Motion, Chief Administrative Office, Regulations
- UID: 4231cbf3-9943-4783-a909-9038acf5d4f6

- Topic: Communication from Erin Spears - Chief of Staff & Counsel, Council Utilities Regulatory Office
- Summary: The communication includes documents related to electric and gas utility matters to be received by the City Council. It contains various reports and filings from Entergy New Orleans, LLC, regarding environmental adjustments, fuel adjustments, purchased gas adjustments, purchased power cost recovery adjustments, annual gas marketing report, and forecasting peak load report.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-95
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The communication was passed as amended.
- Tags/Keywords: Electric and Gas Utility, Entergy New Orleans, LLC, Reports, Filings
- UID: fc25c5ed-0492-4cad-b3d7-9c735f2aabd9

- Topic: Amended Motion to Extend Deadline, UD-21-03
- Summary: The council discussed a motion to extend deadlines related to Entergy's system resiliency and storm hardening docket. There were motions both in support and opposition to the extension.
- Ordinance Number: UD-21-03
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The decision on the motion to extend the deadline was not specified in the provided information.
- Tags/Keywords: Entergy, system resiliency, storm hardening, motion to extend deadline
- UID: cc93c8a4-64a3-4f34-b71f-9f01d20688e5

- Topic: Adoption of Rules for Motor Vehicle Inspection Program
- Summary: The council received communication from Paul Marina regarding the adoption of rules for the motor vehicle inspection program, in compliance with the City of New Orleans Municipal Code. Several documents related to the proposed administrative rules and guidelines were submitted.
- Ordinance Number: Not specified
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The decision on the adoption of the rules was not specified in the provided information.
- Tags/Keywords: Motor vehicle inspection program, administrative rules, Paul Marina
- UID: cc93c8a4-64a3-4f34-b71f-9f01d20688e5

- Topic: Submission of NOTCF 2021 Annual Report

- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The report was electronically submitted and received.
- Tags/Keywords: NOTCF, Annual Report, Tiffany Jackson

- Topic: Demolition permit application for 1233-35 St. Bernard Avenue

- Topic: Amendments to Classified Pay Plan for Human Services

- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A

- Topic: Amendments to Classified Pay Plan (Library)
- Summary: The ordinance proposed amendments to the hiring rates for various library positions, in accordance with the Constitution of Louisiana. The amendments were submitted for Council approval.
- Ordinance Number: Not specified
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendments to the hiring rates for library positions were approved by the Council.
- Tags/Keywords: Library, Classified Pay Plan, Hiring Rates, Louisiana Constitution
- UID: 925e5acd-acde-4ec5-9853-c06aeb53d162

- Topic: Amendments to Classified Pay Plan (Police Referral Pay)
- Summary: The ordinance proposed amendments to the Police Referral Pay, in accordance with the Constitution of Louisiana. The changes were submitted for Council approval.
- Ordinance Number: Not specified
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 1 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendments to the Police Referral Pay were approved by the Council.
- Tags/Keywords: Police Referral Pay, Classified Pay Plan, Louisiana Constitution
- UID: 925e5acd-acde-4ec5-9853-c06aeb53d162

- Topic: Amendments to Classified Pay Plan (Special Rate of Pay)
- Summary: The ordinance proposed amendments to the Special Rates of Pay, including Referral Pay and One Time Referral Pay, in accordance with the Constitution of Louisiana. The changes were submitted for Council approval.
- Ordinance Number: Not specified
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendments to the Special Rates of Pay were approved by the Council.
- Tags/Keywords: Special Rate of Pay, Classified Pay Plan, Louisiana Constitution
- UID: 925e5acd-acde-4ec5-9853-c06aeb53d162

    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)

- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)

- Summary: The ordinance aimed to effect a zoning change in specific lots within the Third Municipal District. The change was from an industrial park district to a single-family residential district. The outcome of the vote was ADOPTED, with a technical correction needed.

- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A)

- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A)

- Topic: Request to Amend Civil Service Commission Rules Regarding Cannabis Testing
- Summary: The resolution requested the Civil Service Commission to evaluate and amend its rules to eliminate cannabis testing as a pre-employment screening requirement and as a basis for termination without clear evidence of impairment or intoxication. 
- Ordinance Number: 33628 - 28965 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Lying Over - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Lying Over for further evaluation
- UID: 63b1720a-3fdf-4992-a866-02a6f596bb7c

- Summary: Motion to overrule the Vieux Carre’ Commission's decision on 533 Toulouse Street, approving the retention of the roof deck and denying the retention of the hot tub.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-119
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Retention of roof deck approved, retention of hot tub denied
- Tags/Keywords: VCC, property, decision, approval, denial

- Topic: Zoning Docket No. 109/21 - Ismail M. Odeh
- Summary: Request for conditional use to permit a minor motor vehicle service and repair facility in an S-B1 Suburban Neighborhood Business District, with 11 provisos recommended for approval by the City Planning Commission.
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO 109-21
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 3/24/22
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to a future meeting
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, conditional use, motor vehicle service, recommendation
- UID: bbe08474-ffe9-4a1b-9e4a-f0920bcf124a

- Topic: ZONING DOCKET NO. 110/21 - GOTHAM MARIGNY PROPERTIES, LLC
- Summary: The ordinance requested a conditional use to permit a bar over 3,000 square feet in floor area in a specific commercial and residential district. The City Planning Commission had no recommendation, and a motion was made to overrule and grant the conditional use request with modifications.
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO 110-21
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The conditional use request was granted with modifications, including the removal of one proviso and the addition of nineteen new provisos.
- UID: 6e4f5e0f-067c-4085-a137-39380b608c35

- Topic: MOTION — NO. M-22-129 —- BY: COUNCILMEMBER KING
- Summary: The motion aimed to overrule and grant the conditional use request for ZD NO. 110/21, along with specific modifications related to the bar's operations and address.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-129
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was passed, and the conditional use request was granted with the specified modifications.
- UID: 6e4f5e0f-067c-4085-a137-39380b608c35

- Topic: Noise Control and Bar Operation Regulations
- Summary: The council discussed and voted on a series of regulations related to noise control and bar operation. These included restrictions on exterior speakers, limitations on hours of operation, requirements for regular noise monitoring, and prohibitions on sidewalk café operations after sunset.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (10 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinances related to noise control and bar operation were passed with a majority vote, imposing various restrictions and requirements on bar owners in the city.
- Tags/Keywords: Noise control, Bar operation, Regulations
